chargeHist.descr: Fail to Pay in Violation of Security Agreement (Value >$500 but <=$10,000)
Fail to Pay in Violation of Security Agreement (Value >$500 but <=$10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas L. Schaefer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Transfer Encumbered Property (Value does not Exceed $500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.84(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid in full by April 4, 2018.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

charges.descr: Transfer Encumbered Property (Value does not Exceed $500)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas L. Schaefer

records.addlTxt: Special Prosecutor, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Pittman.  Victim notification complied with.  Amended information filed.  Restitution has been paid.   Diversion agreement revoked.  Defendant plead guilty to the charge.  Court reviewed the charge and possible penalties of the count the defendant plead to.   Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Transfer Encumbered Property (Value does not Exceed $500) contrary to 943.84(1) a class A misdemeanor.  Joint recommendation for costs only.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered CC only.  $253.00.  Pay in full within 30 days.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2018 at 10:00 am.
STC canceled and scheduled for PLEAS at request of Atty Greg Pittman's office; ok'd with DA's office.
Status conference on January 29, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Pittman appeared by telephone.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court questioned why Mr. Schaefer is not here. Defendant still owed $3,451.00 to the Bank of Galesville.  Extend DPA 3 months.  If not paid in full by then State will move to revoke the agreement.  Court ordered DPA extended to December 31, 2017.
to the Bank of Galesville from the Clerk
Status conference on November 6, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from Attorney Pittman

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Pittman appeared by telephone.  No other appearances.  State said none of the victims have been made whole.  Only 2 payments have been made.  State will file a motion to revoke the deferred agreement.  Attorney Pittman says the diversion agreement runs through the end of the year.  Defendant planning to make payment with his tax refund.  State responded.  Court said he is not violating the agreement.   STC set for 11/6 at 3 pm.
from Bank of Galesville regarding restitution.  Sent to Judge Becker electronically.  JMM
Status conference on January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Pittman appeared by telephone.  No appearance by the defendant.  Defendant hopes to pay a large amount this fall and spring.  Hoping to have it paid by next summer.  He is in a Chapter 12 bankruptcy reorganization.  Defendant has made 1 payment.  Defendant should pay the resitution to the DA's office.  STC 1/23/17 at 3 pm.  Court will need an accounting of what has been paid by that date.
From attorney Greg Pittman to Judge regarding payment
